numbered_ace_sentences: 1. There is an apparent difference between the percentage of men and the percentage of women.
2. Women contact or visit their parents more than men contact or visit their parents.
3. Most young adults contact their parents virtually.
4. Some young adults visit their parents in person.
5. A young adult can contact a parent virtually by texting.
6. A young adult can contact a parent virtually by calling.
7. Long distances between young adults and their parents are a likely reason for virtual contact.
8. Women and men are almost equally likely to visit their parents in person.
9. There is a larger gap between women and men in virtual contact with parents.
10. I wonder what factors contribute to this difference.
11. The survey includes young adults who are 18 years old.
12. The survey includes young adults who are 34 years old.
13. I want the graph to use more specific age groups within the young-adult category.
14. I wonder how many college students contact their parents.
15. I wonder how many young adults in their thirties contact their parents.
16. This graph affects me and my community.
17. In the next couple of years, I will be in college.
18. I am aware that keeping in touch with my parents is important.
19. I may attend a school that is not close to home.
20. Even if I attend a school that is not close to home, I want to keep in touch with my parents.
21. The headline is: Keeping Connected.
